content.title: Error in thomas-iniguez-visioli/youtube-public: Update is not a fast forward - https://docs.github...
content.body:
### Error Details
- **Repository:** thomas-iniguez-visioli/youtube-public
- **Event:** issues
- **Action:** labeled
- **Error Message:** Update is not a fast forward - https://docs.github.com/rest/git/refs#update-a-reference

### Stack Trace
```

    at async GitHubClient.updateRef (file:///home/runner/work/youtube-public/youtube-public/.kanban-action/src/github/api-client.js:71:7)
    at async GitHubClient.commitFile (file:///home/runner/work/youtube-public/youtube-public/.kanban-action/src/github/api-client.js:149:7)
    at async WorkflowManager.processGitHubIssue (file:///home/runner/work/youtube-public/youtube-public/.kanban-action/src/workflow/manager.js:159:9)
    at async run (file:///home/runner/work/youtube-public/youtube-public/.kanban-action/action.js:44:7)
```

content.author: alphaleadership

acceptanceCriteria: The GitHub Action successfully updates the repository's Git reference (e.g., `main` branch HEAD) without encountering 'Update is not a fast forward' errors, even under concurrent updates.

The `commitFile` operation in the GitHub Action incorporates retry logic or a mechanism to re-fetch the latest branch state before attempting to update a reference, ensuring non-fast-forward scenarios are handled gracefully.
Upon a 'labeled' event for an issue, the Kanban integration workflow completes without Git-related errors, and any intended file changes (e.g., to a Kanban board file) are correctly persisted.

fileActions.explanation: To understand the implementation of `updateRef` and `commitFile`, which are directly implicated in the 'not a fast forward' error.
To understand how `processGitHubIssue` calls `commitFile` and the overall workflow that triggers the Git operation.
